original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the sons of gods who lived in the desire realm and the form realm:

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Sons of gods!

original: gang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes zer ba ni /
translated: You say, ‘This elder Subhūti is born after the Tathāgata.’

original: ji ltar rjes su skyes pas gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su skyes pas gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what way is the elder Subhūti born after the Tathāgata?

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa ste /
translated: The elder Subhūti is born after the Tathāgata’s suchness.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the suchness of the Tathāgata is neither come nor gone,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma @464b song bas na /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma @464b song bas na /
translated: so also the suchness of the elder Subhūti is neither come nor gone.

original: thog ma nas gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: thog ma nas gnas brtan rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: From the beginning, the elder Subhūti is born after the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'o //
translated: The thusness of the Tathāgata is also the thusness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang de ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang de ste /
translated: The thusness of all phenomena is also the thusness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de'ang de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de'ang de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: That thusness of the Tathāgata is not thusness.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: In this way, the elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as is the thusness of the Tathāgata,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gnas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: the elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata by abiding in that way.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: Just as the thusness of the Tathāgata is unchanging and nonconceptual, in the same way, the thusness of the elder Subhūti is also unchanging and nonconceptual.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ci la'ang thogs pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang ci la'ang thogs pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ci la'ang thogs pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang ci la'ang thogs pa med de /
translated: Just as the thusness of the Tathāgata is unobstructed with regard to anything, so too the thusness of all phenomena is unobstructed with regard to anything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig cing gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med la de bzhin nyid de'ang ma byas pa ste /🔽de bzhin nyid de ni gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig cing gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med la de bzhin nyid de'ang ma byas pa ste / de bzhin nyid de ni gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang med de /
translated: The thusness of the Tathāgata and the thusness of all phenomena are one thusness, not two, not divided. That thusness is unfabricated.🔽That thusness is not the thusness of anything.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang @465a *//
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang @465a *//
translated: That thusness is not the thusness of anything.

original: med pa de'i phyir de bzhin nyid de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa de'i phyir de bzhin nyid de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that thusness is nondual and indivisible.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: In this way, the elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: The thusness of the Thus-Gone One is unchanging and nonconceptual in all respects.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang thams cad du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang thams cad du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: In the same way, the thusness of the elder Subhūti is unchanging and nonconceptual in all respects.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa /
translated: Just as the thusness of the Thus-Gone One is undifferentiated,

original: dbyer med pa /
analyzed: dbyer med pa /
translated: indivisible,🔽not divisible, and not apprehended,

original: 'byed pa ma yin pa; dmigs su med pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad pa /
analyzed: 'byed pa ma yin pa; dmigs su med pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad pa /
translated: in the same way, the thusness of the elder Subhūti is undifferentiated,

original: dbyer med pa /🔽'byed pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dbyer med pa / 'byed pa ma yin pa /
translated: indivisible,🔽not divisible,

original: dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: and not apprehended.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni /
translated: In this way, the elder Subhūti

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: is born in the footsteps of the Thus-Gone One.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the thusness of the Thus-Gone One is not separate from the thusness of all phenomena,

original: de'ang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin zhing rtag tu de bzhin nyid yin pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor kyang rnam pa gzhan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang gar yang rjes su skyes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin zhing rtag tu de bzhin nyid yin pa de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor kyang rnam pa gzhan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang gar yang rjes su skyes pa med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, just as suchness is not not suchness and is always suchness, in the same way, the elder Subhūti is not otherwise, and although he is born after the Tathāgata, he is not born anywhere.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: Thus, the elder Subhūti is born after the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su @465b skyes so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su @465b skyes so zhes bya ste /
translated: He is said to be born after the Tathāgata.

original: 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis /
translated: By the sameness of the suchness of the past,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do // de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata is the same.🔽By the sameness of the suchness of the Tathāgata, the suchness of the past is the same.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: By the sameness of the suchness of the future, the suchness of the Tathāgata is the same.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //🔽da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do // da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the future is the same as the suchness of the Tathāgata.🔽The suchness of the present is the same as the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyis /
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the same as the suchness of the present.🔽The suchness of the Tathāgata is the same as the suchness of the past.

original: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the past is the same as the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of the past, future, and present and the suchness of the Tathāgata are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of form is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of form and the suchness of the Tathāgata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de @466a *//🔽bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de @466a *// bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of consciousness.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of consciousness and the suchness of the Tathāgata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of dependent origination.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of dependent origination and the suchness of the Tathāgata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the perfection of giving is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the perfection of giving.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of the perfection of giving and the suchness of the Tathāgata are not two, nor are they divided.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.

original: de bzhin gshegs @466b pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @466b pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //🔽nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do // nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of the perfection of wisdom and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two, nor are they divided.🔽The suchness of inner emptiness is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of inner emptiness.

original: de ltar na nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na nang stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of external phenomena and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut asunder.🔽The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.🔽Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut asunder.🔽The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the emptiness of emptiness is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.🔽Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of emptiness and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut asunder.🔽The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the emptiness of great extent.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of great extent is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.🔽Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of great extent and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut asunder.🔽The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽The suchness of the emptiness of ultimate reality is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of ultimate reality and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut asunder.🔽The suchness of the Tathā­gata is the suchness of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the suchness of the Tathā­gata.🔽Thus, the suchness of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena and the suchness of the Tathā­gata are not two nor divided, nor are they cut

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The thusness of the applications of mindfulness is the thusness of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @475a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @475a *//

translated: “This is the skill in means of bodhisattva great beings: to cultivate the perfection of giving, to cultivate the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, to cultivate the applications of mindfulness, to cultivate the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path, to cultivate the ten wholesome actions, to cultivate the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions, to cultivate the five clairvoyances, to cultivate the five aggregates, to cultivate the twelve sense fields, to cultivate the eighteen elements, to cultivate the four noble truths, to cultivate the perfections, to cultivate the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, to cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, to cultivate the four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to to cultivate the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: sems can gzhan gang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya ste /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i legs pa brjod par bya /

analyzed: sems can gzhan gang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o //

original: bdag gis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par bya /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par bya /

original: gzhan yang rnam pa thams @489b cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa thams @489b cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
translated: They should encourage others to generate the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi legs pa brjod par bya /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi legs pa brjod par bya /
translated: They should praise the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: sems can gzhan gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o //
translated: I must praise the abilities of those who generate the wisdom of omniscience in other sentient beings and rejoice in them.

original: bdag gis kyang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya /

original: gzhan yang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
translated: I must encourage others to abandon all the afflictions that are latencies.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i legs pa brjod par bya /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i legs pa brjod par bya /
translated: I must praise the abandonment of all the afflictions that are latencies.

original: sems can gzhan gang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya ste /
translated: I must rejoice in the abandonment of all the afflictions that are latencies in other sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattva great beings who wish to emerge into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should stand in that with a mode of nonapprehending.

analyzed: bdag gis kyang tshe phun sum tshogs pa yongs su gzung bar bya /
translated: “I myself should take up a perfect life span;

original: gzhan yang tshe phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par bskul bar bya /
translated: I should incite others to take up a perfect life span;

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa'i legs pa brjod par bya /
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa'i legs pa brjod par bya /
translated: I should praise the taking up of a perfect life span;

original: sems can gzhan gang tshe phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang tshe phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o //
translated: and I should rejoice in the taking up of a perfect life span by other sentient beings.

original: bdag @490a *// gis kyang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su gzung bar bya /
analyzed: bdag @490a *// gis kyang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su gzung bar bya /

analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su gzung ba la yang dag bar bskul bar bya; dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su gzung ba'i legs pa brjod par bya /
translated: I should praise the preservation of the good doctrine;🔽and I should rejoice in the preservation of the good doctrine by other sentient beings.

original: sems can gzhan gang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang dam pa'i chos gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya ste /
translated: and he should rejoice in the good deeds of others who uphold the holy Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'dod pas /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: should train in this way.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: In this way, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should train in the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: de de ltar slob cing /
analyzed: de de ltar slob cing /
translated: Training in this way,

original: de de ltar gnas pas /
analyzed: de de ltar gnas pas /
translated: abiding in this way,

original: de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: their form will be unobstructed.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness will be unobstructed.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their sense fields, elements, and dependent origination will be unobstructed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening will be unobstructed.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha will be unobstructed.

original: rgyun du @490b zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du @490b zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of the fruit of entering the stream will be unobstructed.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the knowledge of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the knowledge of arhatship will be unobstructed.

original: rang byang chub shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang byang chub shes pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of individual enlightenment will be unobstructed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Entering into the maturity of a bodhisattva will be unobstructed.

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bringing beings to maturity and purifying a buddhafield will be unobstructed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom of omniscience will be unobstructed.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The elimination of all afflictive emotions and habitual tendencies will be unobstructed.

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of lifespan will be unobstructed.

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The duration of the sacred Dharma will be unobstructed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma bzung /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma bzung / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung /
translated: It is because the bodhisattva mahāsattvas have not previously appropriated form,🔽have not appropriated feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ngo //
translated: and have not appropriated the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ngo //
translated: He did not appropriate any of the perfections, any of the emptinesses, or any of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su ma @491a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su ma @491a *//
translated: He did not appropriate any of the buddhadharmas up to and including the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

analyzed: bzung ngo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ngo //
translated: He did not appropriate any of the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects up to and including the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin /
translated: it is because that which is not apprehended as form is not form.🔽That which is not apprehended as feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is not consciousness.🔽That which is not apprehended as the sense fields is not the sense fields.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is not apprehended as the constituents is not the constituents.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin /
translated: That which is not apprehended as dependent origination is not dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of vigour, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not apprehended.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ma yin /
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not apprehended.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four correct knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this stage of the bodhisattvas was being taught,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: two thousand bodhisattvas attained the forbearance of the nonproduction of dharmas.

original: le'u sum cu brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u sum cu brgyad pa'o ////
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines, Chapter Thirty-Eight.

analyzed: de @491b skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: The Blessed One having said this,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa ni gang lags /

analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang lags /

analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: How should we know that this bodhisattva great being is irreversible?

analyzed: zhes bgyi bar 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: This is what I will do.🔽🔽

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la so so'i skye bo'i sa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar bshad pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: “Subhūti, here, all that has been explained as the level of ordinary beings, the level of śrāvakas, the level of pratyekabuddhas, the level of bodhisattvas, and the level of tathāgatas,

analyzed: de bzhin nyid la 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: Suchness is unchanging,

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: nonconceptual, nondual, and indivisible.

analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid de ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jug ste /
translated: It is suchness, and it engages in suchness just as it is.

translated: It engages in suchness without conceptualization, and it engages in suchness in that way without conceptualization.🔽When it engages in suchness in that way, just as it is,

analyzed: de las 'das te de dag de bzhin nyid la re re dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par the tshom za ba gang yang med do //
translated: it hears suchness, and it does not have any doubts about suchness, whether it is singular or dual or neither.

original: de ni byung rgyal du smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni byung rgyal du smra ba ma yin te /

original: don dang ldan par smra'i /
analyzed: don dang ldan par smra'i /

original: don dang mi ldan par smra pa ma yin /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par smra pa ma yin /

analyzed: @492a *// gzhan gyis byas pa dang ma byas pa la mi lta zhing /

original: legs par brjod pa 'tshol ba yin te /
analyzed: legs par brjod pa 'tshol ba yin te /
translated: It seeks out what is well spoken.

analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are irreversible.🔽Subhūti then asked,

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bgyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /

original: tshul med pa /
analyzed: tshul med pa /
translated: without attributes,

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: and without signs.🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa /

original: tshul ma mchis pa /
analyzed: tshul ma mchis pa /
translated: without attributes,

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /🔽chos gang rnams las slar ldog pa'i slad du /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na / chos gang rnams las slar ldog pa'i slad du /
translated: and without signs,🔽from what phenomena do bodhisattva great beings turn away

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa zhes bstan pa lags sam /
translated: so that they are called irreversible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /

analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those modes, and those signs should be known as irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni khe dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni khe dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings do not pursue gain, honor, or verse.

original: bsod snyoms lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: bsod snyoms lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: They do not pursue alms.

original: chos gos gsum pa'i bar du lhur len pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa'i bar du lhur len pa ma yin zhing /
translated: They do not pursue the three Dharma robes,

original: de sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyang yang dag par blangs te spyod do //
analyzed: de sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis kyang yang dag par blangs te spyod do //
translated: and they take up and practice the twelve ascetic practices.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig @498a *//🔽par bya'o // rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig @498a *// par bya'o // rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those modes, and those signs are irreversible.

original: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ser sna'i sems skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ser sna'i sems skye ba med do //
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, in irreversible bodhisattva great beings a miserly mind does not arise.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems skye ba med do //🔽'khrug pa'i sems skye ba med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems skye ba med do // 'khrug pa'i sems skye ba med do //
translated: A mind of bad moral discipline does not arise.🔽A mind of anger does not arise.

original: le lo'i sems skye ba med do //
analyzed: le lo'i sems skye ba med do //
translated: A mind of laziness does not arise.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems skye ba med do //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems skye ba med do //
translated: A mind of distraction does not arise.🔽A mind of bad wisdom does not arise.

original: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems skye ba med do; ;phrag dog gi sems skye ba med do //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems skye ba med do; ;phrag dog gi sems skye ba med do //
translated: A mind of envy does not arise.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those modes, and those signs are irreversible.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, in irreversible bodhisattva great beings a mind of miserliness does not arise.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa ni blo brtan pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa ni blo brtan pa yin /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva has a firm mind.

original: blo zab pa yin /
analyzed: blo zab pa yin /
translated: He has a profound mind.

original: gus par gzhan la chos nyan pa yin /
analyzed: gus par gzhan la chos nyan pa yin /
translated: He listens respectfully to the Dharma from others.

original: gzhan las chos gang ci thos kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las chos gang ci thos kyang /
translated: Whatever Dharma he hears from others,

original: de thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: de thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par sgrub pa yin /
translated: he practices it all through the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te /
translated: Whatever worldly activities there are, he practices them all in dependence on the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub cing /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub cing /
translated: He practices them through the nature of reality.

original: chos gang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'byor pa de lta bu gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos gang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'byor pa de lta bu gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any Dharma that is not included in the dharmadhātu.

original: de thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'byor par yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'byor par yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba yin te /
translated: He sees that all of them are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub @498b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub @498b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that these are the defining characteristics of the irreversible great bodhisattva beings.

original: rab 'byor / de la gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mdun du bdud sdig to can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mdun du bdud sdig to can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “Subhūti, if in the presence of the irreversible great bodhisattva beings, the evil Māra conjures up the eight great hells,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po re rer yang /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po re rer yang /
translated: and in each of the great hells🔽many hundreds of bodhisattvas,🔽many thousands of bodhisattvas,🔽many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag mang po /🔽byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgya phrag mang po / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po /
translated: many millions of bodhisattvas,🔽many tens of millions of bodhisattvas,🔽many billions of bodhisattvas,🔽many tens of billions of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag mang po /🔽byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag mang po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag mang po / byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag mang po /
translated: many trillions of bodhisattvas,🔽many quintillions of bodhisattvas,🔽many hundreds of quintillions of bodhisattvas,🔽many thousands of quintillions of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba brgya phrag mang po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba brgya phrag mang po /
translated: many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of bodhisattvas,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the atoms in a world system,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the dust particles in a world system,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the night sky,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the daytime,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the evening,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the morning,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the first watch of the night,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the middle watch of the night,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the last watch of the night,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the four directions,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the four intermediate directions,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the zenith,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the nadir,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the four continents,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the four great continents,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the trichiliocosm,🔽many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the great trichiliocosm,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po /
translated: many bodhisattvas as numerous as the stars in the thousandfold world system

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig phrag mang po bsreg cing btso ba dang / mi bzad par sdug bsngal ba dang / rtsub pa dang / tsha ba'i tshor ba myong bar mngon du sprul nas bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig phrag mang po bsreg cing btso ba dang / mi bzad par sdug bsngal ba dang / rtsub pa dang / tsha ba'i tshor ba myong bar mngon du sprul nas bstan te /
translated: He manifests many quintillions of bodhisattvas being burned and boiled, experiencing unbearable, harsh, and intense pain.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la 'di skad du /
translated: He teaches them, saying,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni phyir mi ldog par de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni phyir mi ldog par de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yin te /
translated: ‘These bodhisattva great beings have been predicted by the Tathāgata to be irreversible,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po 'dir skyes so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po 'dir skyes so //
translated: but they have been born in this great hell.

original: khyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pas phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pas phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa ni /
translated: You, too, have been predicted by the Tathāgata to be irreversible,

original: sems can dmyal bar lung bstan te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar lung bstan te /
translated: but you have been predicted to be in hell.

original: da dung yang khyod kyis byang chub kyi sems 'di thong zhig dang / khyod sems can dmyal bar skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: da dung yang khyod kyis byang chub kyi sems 'di thong zhig dang / khyod sems can dmyal bar skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you give up this thought of awakening, you will not be born in hell.

original: de ltar byos dang / khyod mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang /
analyzed: de ltar byos dang / khyod mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang /
translated: Do that, and you will go to the higher realms.’

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub @499a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub @499a *//
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattvas🔽

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'khrug cing nem nur med /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'khrug cing nem nur med /
translated: Subhūti, if the thought of a bodhisattva great being is not disturbed, is not doubtful,

original: the tshom med na /
analyzed: the tshom med na /
translated: and is not uncertain,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang lung bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang lung bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: then you should know that bodhisattva great being has been predicted by the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nges pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nges pa yin te /
translated: That bodhisattva great being is definite,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i khams su gnas pa'o //🔽rab 'byor / 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs med pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i khams su gnas pa'o // rab 'byor / 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs med pa ste /
translated: and abides in the irreversible element.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible and there is no chance that a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible will be born in the hells,🔽in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: or in the world of Yama.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te /
translated: Subhuti, you should know that a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who possesses these aspects, characteristics, and signs is a non-regressing Bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: 'di skad du gang khyod kyis sngon 'di ltar bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang khyod kyis sngon 'di ltar bdag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, if Māra, the evil one, were to come to a non-regressing Bodhisattva-mahāsattva in the guise of a monk, and say: In the past, you have thought like this: 'I will perfect the perfection of generosity.'

original: 'di ltar bdag gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //🔽'di ltar bdag gis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o // 'di ltar bdag gis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: You have thought like this: 'I will perfect the perfection of morality.'🔽You have thought like this: 'I will perfect the perfection of patience.'

original: 'di ltar bdag gis brtson 'grus @499b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis brtson 'grus @499b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o /
translated: You have thought like this: 'I will perfect the perfection of effort.'

original: 'di ltar bdag gis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in the perfection of meditative stability.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis nang stong pa nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis nang stong pa nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in inner emptiness.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: I should train in the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and eightfold noble path.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o; ;'di ltar bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o; ;'di ltar bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, I will purify the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, up to and including omniscience.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes nas /
translated: In this way, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.’

original: thos par gyur pa de dag shogs shig /
analyzed: thos par gyur pa de dag shogs shig /
translated: “You should confess whatever you have heard.🔽Let go of it!

original: thongs shig / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos dang bcas pa rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: thongs shig / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos dang bcas pa rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: The thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past, present, and future, together with their hearers, have taken hold of the roots of virtue that arise from the first generation of the mind of awakening,

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag @500a *//
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag @500a *//
translated: up to and including the roots of virtue that arise from the Dharma remaining in the world.

original: thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba de dag kyang so sor shogs shig /
analyzed: thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba de dag kyang so sor shogs shig /
translated: You should confess and give up all your regrets about what you have heard.

original: thongs shig / gang khyod kyis thos pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin /
analyzed: thongs shig / gang khyod kyis thos pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin /
translated: What you have heard is not the word of the Buddha.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It was not spoken by the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: de ni rang bzor byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzor byas pa'o //
translated: It is a fabrication.

original: gang ngas bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ste /
analyzed: gang ngas bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ste /
translated: What I have taught is the word of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o zhes zer la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o zhes zer la /
translated: It was spoken by the Tathāgata.’

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khrug cing nem nur byed dam /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khrug cing nem nur byed dam /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being is disturbed, doubtful, or uncertain,

original: the tshom za na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis lung ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom za na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis lung ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that bodhisattva great being has not been predicted by the former thus-gone ones, the worthy ones, the perfect buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: That bodhisattva is not definite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i khams su gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i khams su gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: That bodhisattva does not stand in the unmoving element.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'khrug cing nem nur mi byed /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'khrug cing nem nur mi byed /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being is not disturbed, does not doubt,

original: the tshom mi za la chos nyid la brten cing mngon par 'du ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa la brten te /
analyzed: the tshom mi za la chos nyid la brten cing mngon par 'du ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa la brten te /
translated: does not wonder, relies on the dharma-constituent, relies on the unconditioned, and relies on the unborn,

original: gzhan la yid mi ches pas mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: gzhan la yid mi ches pas mi 'gro zhing /
translated: and does not go along with the ideas of others,

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la snying snyan bcug kyang de'i sems gzhan du mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyang thob par mi 'gyur /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i chags pa ston pa ni /
translated: He will not attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽He is showing me attachment,

analyzed: dge slong 'di dag kun kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug 'jug pa sha stag ste /

analyzed: de dag kyang dgra bcom pa nyid la gnas par gyur na /

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /
translated: and they do not fall to the level of a pratyekabuddha,

original: de las kyang gong du 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de las kyang gong du 'di snyam ste /
translated: and they think, ‘Even higher than that,🔽the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving,

translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi @504a *//

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de ltar spyod pa ni / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i gnas med /

analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no snyam na /

translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, those modes, and those signs are irreversible.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yongs su mi nyams /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yongs su mi nyams /

translated: they do not regress from the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid las yongs su mi nyams /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid las yongs su mi nyams /

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams /

analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa las yongs su mi nyams /
translated: they do not regress from the applications of mindfulness,

translated: they do not regress from the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or the eightfold noble path;

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las yongs su mi nyams /

analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
translated: the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the concentrations, the doors of concentration,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las yongs su mi nyams /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las yongs su mi nyams /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams so snyam la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams so snyam la /
translated: and up to the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sus bdud kyi las su rig pa de ni /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who think, ‘Whoever knows the deeds of Māra

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su mi nyams so snyam na /
translated: will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,’

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, you should know that a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has these aspects, this nature, and these characteristics is a non-regressing Bodhisattva.

analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Buddha having said this, the Venerable Subhuti addressed the Buddha, saying:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ci las slar ldog pa'i slad du /

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bgyi ba lags /

original: @505a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @505a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: rab 'byor / de ni gzugs kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni gzugs kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: Subhuti, it is because he regresses from the perception of form,🔽regresses from the perception of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / khams kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / khams kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: regresses from the perception of the sense realms, and regresses from the perception of the elements.

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'du shes dang / zhe sdang gi 'du shes dang / gti mug gi 'du shes dang / lta ba'i rnam pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /

translated: They turn away from the perception of the perfections, the perception of emptiness, the perception of the applications of mindfulness, the perception of the right efforts, the perception of the legs of miraculous power, the perception of the faculties, the perception of the powers, the perception of the branches of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: and the perception of the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: They turn away from the perception of the noble truths, the perception of the concentrations, the perception of the immeasurables, and the perception of the formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the notion of the powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i 'du @505b shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i 'du @505b shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: and the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: up to the notion of complete buddhahood.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: They turn back from the notion of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes las phyir ldog go /
translated: and from the notion of bodhisattvas and buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: Because the irreversible bodhisattva great being, on account of all phenomena being empty of their own marks,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
translated: enters into the maturity of a bodhisattva.

original: des chos rdul tsam yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: des chos rdul tsam yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: And he does not apprehend even the minutest phenomenon.

original: dmigs pa med pas mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Since he does not apprehend anything, he does not form mental constructs.

original: mngon pas 'du mi byed pas skye ba med de /
analyzed: mngon pas 'du mi byed pas skye ba med de /
translated: Since he does not form mental constructs, he is not born.

original: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the irreversible bodhisattva great being’s acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as irreversible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: le'u sum cu dgu pa'o ////

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su mi 'dzin to //

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su mi 'dzin to //

original: rang byang chub thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par mi byed do //
translated: nor individual enlightenment.🔽He does not make any of those into a basis.

analyzed: de 'dod na ched du bsams shing lus yongs su 'dzin te /

analyzed: lus gang gis sems can rnams kyi don bya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin to //

analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //

translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva great being is endowed with the mental activity of awakening, is not separated from the thought of awakening, and does not take form to be paramount.

analyzed: mtshan ma lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: He does not take marks to be paramount.

analyzed: lus lhur len pa ma yin /

analyzed: shes rab lhur len pa ma yin /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams lhur len pa ma yin /
