translated: “He does not think, ‘I am not one who will regress or not regress,’🔽and he does not have any doubts.

original: the tshom mi skye zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do //
analyzed: the tshom mi skye zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do //
translated: He has no uncertainty about his own level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar des phyir ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa ma yin pa'i chos @514a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar des phyir ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa ma yin pa'i chos @514a *//
translated: And why?

original: rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because he does not see even an atom’s worth of something that would regress or not regress.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i skyes bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i skyes bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: “To illustrate further, Subhūti,

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: a person who is a stream enterer does not have any doubts or uncertainty about the level of a stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / dgra bcom pa dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / dgra bcom pa dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Those who are once-returners do not doubt or waver about the stage of the once-returners.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽rang sangs rgyas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // rang sangs rgyas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Those who are non-returners do not doubt or waver about the stage of the non-returners.🔽Those who are arhats do not doubt or waver about the stage of the arhats.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Those who are pratyekabuddhas do not doubt or waver about the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not doubt or waver about the stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /🔽rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /🔽rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: The perfect buddhas do not doubt or waver about the stage of the perfect buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la gnas pa yang nem nur med cing the tshom mi za zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la gnas pa yang nem nur med cing the tshom mi za zhing /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on his own stage is without doubt and without uncertainty.

original: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas te /
analyzed: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas te /
translated: He, standing on that irreversible stage,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: purifies the buddhafield and

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: ripens beings.

original: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
translated: He knows the works of Māra as they arise,

original: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro /
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro /
translated: and he does not fall under the power of the works of Māra.

original: bdud kyi las de dag thams cad kyang rnam par 'joms shing srab mor byed do //
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag thams cad kyang rnam par 'joms shing srab mor byed do //
translated: He overcomes and weakens all those works of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / @514b mtshams med pa byed byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'chi ka'i bar du'ang mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
analyzed: dper na / @514b mtshams med pa byed byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'chi ka'i bar du'ang mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
translated: For example, a person who has committed a heinous crime is not separated from the thought of the heinous crime until they die.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: That thought of the heinous crime follows them.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems de thabs mkhas pa thams cad kyis kyang rnam par gzhil bar mi nus te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de thabs mkhas pa thams cad kyis kyang rnam par gzhil bar mi nus te /
translated: That thought of the heinous karma cannot be dispelled by any skillful means.

original: kun nas ldang ba de 'chi ka'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba de 'chi ka'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: That thought of the heinous karma will follow him until his death.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the thought of irreversibility of a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible from awakening is established in the irreversible stage.

original: sems de rnam par brtag tu med cing mi skul bas /
analyzed: sems de rnam par brtag tu med cing mi skul bas /
translated: That thought cannot be analyzed or shaken.

original: de ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot turn him back.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar sems des lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems des lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
translated: Because that thought has transcended the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs pas de rang gi sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs pas de rang gi sa la gnas shing /
translated: Having entered into the faultless, he remains in his own stage.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pas /
translated: Having attained the highest perfection of the superknowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: they purify a Buddha-field;

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir /
translated: they bring beings to maturity;

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'ang 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'ang 'gro'o //
translated: and they go from Buddha-field to Buddha-field in order to see the Buddhas, the Lords, to honor them and to hear the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po'ang bskyed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po'ang bskyed cing /
translated: And in those Buddha-fields they plant wholesome roots with those Buddhas, the Lords,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun 'dri zhing yongs su zhu ba byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun 'dri zhing yongs su zhu ba byed /
translated: and they ask questions of those Buddhas, the Lords,

original: bsnyen bkur byed do //🔽@515a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed do // @515a *// rab 'byor /
translated: and they honor them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de ltar gnas pas bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba rnams khong du chud de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de ltar gnas pas bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba rnams khong du chud de /
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, how does he stand in the perfection of giving, and how does he stand in the perfection of morality, patience, vigour, and concentration?🔽And how does he stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag gi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag gi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
translated: How does he stand in the perfection of giving?

original: bdud kyi las de dag kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed cing de rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed cing de rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: and those deeds of Māra he will turn into the very threshold of the knowledge of all modes, and he will not doubt or waver about his own level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pas /🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig gam /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pas / yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig gam /
translated: Because he does not doubt the very threshold of the knowledge of all modes.

original: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see the very threshold of the knowledge of all modes as one or two.

original: de ltar shes pas de tshe 'phos nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar shes pas de tshe 'phos nas kyang /
translated: And because he knows thus, then even when he has passed on from this world,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems mi skye'o //
translated: the thought of the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level does not occur to him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva great beings, seeing all dharmas as empty of their own marks,

original: chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: do not see any dharma that is produced or stopped,

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: or defiled or purified.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du mi byed de /
translated: Subhuti : If, when he has passed away, he thinks, 'I shall not win full enlightenment', then he will not win full enlightenment.

original: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
translated: But if he thinks, 'I shall certainly win full enlightenment', then he will win full enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa @515b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa @515b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Because the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment is empty of own-mark.🔽Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who thus stands in his own stage, cannot be overcome by any of the gods, Nagas, Yakshas, Gandharvas, Asuras, Garudas, Kinnaras, or Mahoragas, by any of the gods, men, or Asuras.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the irreversible bodhisattva great being who is thus situated has the knowledge of non-grasping.

original: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: Subhūti, if Māra the wicked one, having approached an irreversible bodhisattva great being in the guise of a buddha,

original: 'di skad du khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig /🔽khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad du khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig / khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
translated: were to say, ‘You should attain the state of an arhat right here and now.🔽You have not been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis gang gis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod kyis ma thob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis gang gis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod kyis ma thob bo //
translated: You have not attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, through which you would be prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.’

original: rnam pa gang dag dang / tshul gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag dang / tshul gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang /
translated: “What are the aspects, what are the modes, and what are the signs of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have received a prophecy regarding unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”🔽

original: mtshan ma de dag kyang khyod la med do zhes zer yang /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag kyang khyod la med do zhes zer yang /
translated: “Those aspects, those modes, and those signs that bodhisattva great beings who have received a prophecy about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening have, you do not have those aspects, those modes, and those signs.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra de thos nas mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra de thos nas mi 'jum mi 'gong zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, if, when bodhisattva great beings hear that, they are not cowed, do not draw back,

original: de'i @516a *// sems gzhan du mi 'gyur la yid skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i @516a *// sems gzhan du mi 'gyur la yid skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: and their minds do not change, and their minds are not frightened,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should know that ‘I have been prophesied by those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: “It is thus: I have those dharmas through which a bodhisattva mahāsattva is predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te bdud sdig to can nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te bdud sdig to can nam /
translated: Subhūti, if a bad demon,

original: bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig /
analyzed: bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig /
translated: or a person inspired by a demon,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: were to come into the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva in the guise of a buddha,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: and predict him to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan kyang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan kyang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level, but if that bodhisattva mahāsattva were to think, ‘The tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: predict bodhisattva mahāsattvas to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la'ang yang dag par bskul ba mi mdzad de /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la'ang yang dag par bskul ba mi mdzad de /
translated: They do not even encourage them to attain the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam /
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam /
translated: “Alas, this is a wicked Māra,

original: bdud sdig to can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig /
translated: or a person inspired by a wicked Māra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs so snyam sems pa dang / gal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs so snyam sems pa dang / gal te /
translated: who has come here in the guise of a buddha.”

original: rab 'byor / @516b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @516b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: “Subhūti, if a wicked Māra, in the guise of a buddha, comes to bodhisattva great beings who are reading and reciting the extensive sūtras,

original: de la 'di skad du gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin te /
translated: and says to them, ‘These sūtras that you are practicing are taught by Māra.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: They are not taught by the lord buddhas, śrāvakas, or pratyekabuddhas,’

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par yang rnam pa gang dag dang / tshul gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por brjod pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma rnams ston pa'i mthu mnga' na /
translated: But, Lord, how can the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being, be known as irreversible?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la @519b spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la @519b spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of giving, stands in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, and as he courses in the perfection of giving gives gifts, how can he be known as irreversible?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: They perfect the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They perfect the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions, as well as the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: khyod de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas zab mo rnams dri bar sems @520a *//🔽pa legs so //
analyzed: khyod de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas zab mo rnams dri bar sems @520a *// pa legs so //
translated: You have thought well to question the Tathagata about the profound abiding nature of dharmas for the sake of irreversible Bodhisattva Great Beings.

original: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Subhuti, this “profound” is a synonym for emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: It is a synonym for signlessness, wishlessness, no composition, no production, no cessation, no defilement, no purification,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: and for suchness, reality-limit, and Dharma-element.

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags de dag ni gnas zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go /
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags de dag ni gnas zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go /
translated: Subhuti, these are synonyms for the profound, profound abiding nature of dharmas.

original: gsol pa / de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags su bas kyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags su bas kyi /
translated: Subhūti replied, “It is the term for nirvāṇa,

original: chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags ma lags sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags ma lags sam /
translated: but is it not also the term for all dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags kyang de yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags kyang de yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, ‘profound’ is also the term for all dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, form is profound.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab bo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab bo //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are profound.

original: rab 'byor / mig zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, the eyes are profound.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid zab bo //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid zab bo //
translated: The ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are profound.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, a form is profound.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos zab bo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos zab bo //
translated: A sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, and a dharma are profound.

original: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, the eye consciousness is profound.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zab bo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zab bo //
translated: Eye contact and the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact are profound.

original: rab 'byor rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind consciousnesses are profound.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa @520b dang; yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zab bo //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa @520b dang; yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, the eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking mind contact, and the feelings that arise from the condition of eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking mind contact are profound.

original: rab 'byor / sa'i khams zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sa'i khams zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, the earth element is profound.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zab bo //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zab bo //
translated: The water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are profound.

original: rab 'byor / ma rig pa zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma rig pa zab bo //
translated: Subhūti, ignorance is profound.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang; skye ba dang / rga shi zab bo //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang; skye ba dang / rga shi zab bo //
translated: Formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death are profound.

original: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zab pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zab pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of awakening are profound.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the complete liberations, the meditative stabilizations, the emptiness, the signless,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo zab bo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo zab bo //
translated: the wishless, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are deep;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad zab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad zab bo //
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are deep;

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab bo //
translated: and, Subhūti, up to the knowledge of all aspects is deep.

original: byang chub zab bo //
analyzed: byang chub zab bo //
translated: Awakening is deep.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na gzugs zab /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na gzugs zab /
translated: Subhūti, how is form deep?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab /🔽ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel @521a *//
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zab / ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel @521a *//
translated: How are feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness profound?

original: par 'byung ba zab /
analyzed: par 'byung ba zab /
translated: How are the sense domains, elements, and dependent origination profound?

original: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zab /
analyzed: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zab /
translated: How are all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening profound?

original: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du zab /
analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du zab /
translated: How are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha profound?

original: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zab /
translated: How are , up to and including omniscience, profound?

original: ji ltar na byang chub zab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub zab ce na /
translated: How is awakening profound?

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs zab bo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs zab bo //
translated: Form is as profound as the suchness of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa zab bo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa zab bo //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are as profound as the suchness of consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab bo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab bo //
translated: The suchness of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination is just as it is, and so dependent origination is profound.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The suchness of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the factors of awakening is just as it is, and so

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zab bo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zab bo //
translated: the factors of awakening are profound.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar ba dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar ba dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The suchness of the noble truths, concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, liberations, serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo rnams zab bo //

translated: The dhāraṇī gateways are profound just as the suchness of the gateways of mnemonic incantation is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams @521b pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams zab bo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zab bo //

analyzed: byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du byang chub zab bo //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags /
